task.title: Key Pairs landing page
task.shortdesc: The Key Pairs landing page allows you to view a list of your key pairs, create new key pairs, and delete key pairs. You can delete multiple key pairs at one time by checking the boxes next to the key pairs you want to delete. Use the scroll bar to view additional key pairs not in the browser's current view.

taskbody.prereq: To access this page from the dashboard, click Key pairs from the left navigation bar under NETWORK & SECURITY or click the key icon from the Key pairs tile:

step.cmd: From the dashboard, locate the Key pairs tile and click Create key pair.
From the Key pairs landing page, click the Create Key Pair button near the top of the page.

taskbody.result:
The Create new key pair page opens.
For additional information on completing that page, refer to the instructions provided in its Help content.

step.cmd: Access the Key Pairs landing page from the dashboard.
From the Key pairs landing page, click the down arrow next to the Create Key Pair button near the top of the page.
Click Import Public Key to select it.

taskbody.result:
The Import public key page opens.
For additional information on completing that page, refer to the instructions provided in its Help content.

task.title: Viewing Details of a Key Pair
task.shortdesc: You can see details about a key pair, including its fingerprint information:

step.cmd: Click the name of the key pair in the list of key pairs.
In the Actions column, click the action icon (･･･) for the key pair you want to view and select View details.

taskbody.result: The details page for the selected key pair opens.

task.title: Actions
task.shortdesc: Two Action operations are available from the Keypair landing page:

step.cmd: The More Actions button above the list of key pairs has a context menu that allow you to apply an action to a particular key pair or multiple key pairs.

substep.cmd: Select one key pair and both the View details and the Delete key options are available.
Select multiple key pairs from the list and only the Delete key option is available.

step.cmd: Click the action icon (･･･) from the Actions column of a corresponding entry in the key pairs list, and the following action(s) can be performed:

substep.cmd: View details. Displays more information about the selected key pair.
Delete key. Removes the selected key pair upon confirming the deletion.
